column4: come on folks, someone help me with my samba rx error problem?
you have your socket options setup on the server?
what version of ubuntu is the client?
no the ubuntu distro version (ie: 6.06 LTS, 6.10, 7.04)
in the [global]  sectin of the smb.conf, put the option "log level = 8"
if you want more detailed logs, ususally its set to 2, and can't be maximally set to 10
this is for the client side right?
whats the network infrastructure look like ravi_master ?
no, server side, in the case of windows, you'll need to check its errors, sorry i thought you were on Linux
err sorry i thought your server was linux for a minute
this setup is still working fine in between a laptop plugged into the same router as the windows server and ubuntu client
that laptop is running windows
well, either way, whats the network infrastructure?
ok, it's just a netgear router
full duplex?
yeah
hmmm, i'm not sure then, i've never dealt with samba clients. i generally serve via linux
check your server's logs though
hold on, seems like I get rx errors on a ping too
just didn't ping long enough
